title: Drawing, "Dancing Fame with Lyre, Sala di Recezione, Palazzo Quirinale, Rome", 1812
medium: Pen and dark gray ink, brush and color washes over black chalk ruled lines on beige wove paper
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Fame plays lyre and dances. On ground at left, basket and trumpet; at right, two garlands. Ruled lines in black chalk suggest rectangular molding.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Dancing Fame with Lyre, Sala di Recezione, Palazzo Quirinale, Rome", 1812.
1812. Pen and dark gray ink, brush and color washes over black chalk ruled lines on beige wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-3070.
